ranges.notes: Public holiday, most attractions and businesses closed. Vienna Philharmonic New Year's Concert broadcast globally.
Winter season with fewer tourists. Ideal for museums, coffeehouses, and indoor activities.
Peak of the ball season with over 450 balls throughout the city. Highlights include the Opera Ball, Imperial Ball, and Philharmonic Ball.
Winter continues. Great opportunities for indoor cultural activities. Winter sales ongoing at shops.
Vienna's elegant ball season reaches its peak. Vienna Opera Ball is typically held in February.
Winter season continues. Perfect time for museums, concerts, and coffeehouses.
Special menus at restaurants. Romantic horse-drawn carriage rides through the city center.
Quiet period. Winter activities and indoor cultural experiences still the main focus.
Early spring with gradually warming temperatures. Vienna gradually emerges from winter.
Colorful Easter markets open in squares throughout Vienna, particularly at Schönbrunn Palace and Freyung.
Beautiful decorations and Easter markets across the city. Schönbrunn Palace Easter Market is particularly popular.
Spring blooms in full force. City parks and gardens at their best. Ideal time to visit Schönbrunn Gardens and Belvedere.
Public holiday. Parades and events throughout the city.
Perfect spring weather. Rose gardens at Volksgarten in bloom. Outdoor cafes bustling.
Major performing arts festival begins, bringing international productions to Vienna's stages.
Performing arts festival continues. Pleasant early summer weather.
Long daylight hours. Excellent for outdoor activities in the Vienna Woods, Prater, and along the Danube.
Film Festival at Rathausplatz shows classical concerts and opera on big screens with international food stalls. ImPulsTanz contemporary dance festival. Warm evenings ideal for outdoor activities.
Peak summer tourism. Warmest month. Many local Viennese on vacation.
Public holiday. Some shops and attractions may be closed.
Open-air film screenings and food fair continue. High tourist season continues.

ranges.event: Vienna Wine Hiking Days, MQ Vienna Fashion Week
ranges.notes: Pleasant temperatures. Wine taverns (Heurigen) in surrounding vineyards especially active. Fashion events throughout the city.
Autumn colors in Vienna Woods and city parks. Wine taverns serve the new season's wine (Sturm).
Public holiday with military parade, open doors at government buildings, and special events.
Fall colors continue. Museums and indoor cultural venues begin new exhibition seasons.
Public holiday. Many Viennese visit cemeteries. Some businesses closed.
Quieter season begins. Museums, cafes, and concert venues ideal.
Vienna's famous Christmas markets begin to open, including those at Rathausplatz, Schönbrunn, Belvedere, and Maria-Theresien-Platz.
Vienna's Christmas markets in full operation. Festive decorations throughout the city.
Public holiday. Christmas markets especially busy.
Peak time for Christmas markets. Special advent concerts in churches and concert halls.
Christmas Eve (Heiligabend) and Christmas Days are public holidays. Many businesses closed, including most Christmas markets. Special masses at St. Stephen's Cathedral.
Period between Christmas and New Year. Many tourists for holiday season.
Huge celebrations on Silvesterpfad trail through the old city. Fireworks at midnight. Vienna Philharmonic New Year's Eve Concert. Waltz dancing in front of City Hall.

spring: Exploring blooming gardens at Schönbrunn Palace and Belvedere
Easter Markets at Schönbrunn, Am Hof, and Freyung
Vienna Woods hiking as forests come alive
Outdoor cafe culture resumes along the Ring
summer: Film Festival at Rathausplatz with international cuisine
Swimming at Danube beaches and Alte Donau
Vienna Woods hiking and vineyard tours
Evening walks along the illuminated Ring Boulevard
Prater amusement park and ferris wheel
Outdoor dining in historic squares and gardens
autumn: Vineyard hiking and new wine (Sturm) tasting
Vienna Woods with spectacular fall foliage
Museum and gallery visits as new seasons begin
Coffee house culture in historic cafes
Classical music season at major venues
Schönbrunn and Belvedere parks in autumn colors
winter: Ice skating at Rathausplatz and Konzerthaus
Concert season at Vienna's renowned venues
New Year's Eve celebrations along Silvesterpfad

scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Ideal conditions, significant positive events, pleasant weather, potentially moderate crowds
scoreDescription.4: Good: Favorable conditions, good weather, possibly some key events, manageable or festive crowds
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, potential for cold/snow (winter) or heat/crowds (summer), moderate tourism or holiday peaks
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, potential for closures (holidays), excessive heat or cold/wet weather
scoreDescription.1: Poor: Generally unfavorable conditions for typical tourism (rarely applicable to Vienna)
